text:
Hello everybody. I have 2 questions :
- Is it possible de create a multiple-step form with HubSpot ? 
- Is it possible de synchronize HubDB with an extern MySQL base ?
Thanks a lot for your answers
form dependent fields: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/forms/can-i-create-a-multi-step-form>
I'm sure you could synch the table by using the api, but that would seem like a lot of work. I would thinking creating an api you can access using JS for your mysql db easier than synching the two
Thanks <@U25PYL3Q8> you’re so fast. I was at the Inbound17. I regret not meeting you there :disappointed:
I didn't make it this year. I had some issues with the hurricane that happened in my area and I needed to be at home still
You can use the import API to synchronize with an external database.

FYI - Google is making a change in then end of October to show "Not Secure" messaging to anyone completing a form on a non-SSL page. I'd highly, highly suggest getting SSL setup ASAP.  - <https://www.engadget.com/2017/04/28/chrome-http-not-secure-warning/>
<@U22PKFRU5> How do we work this with clients that only have landing pages in HubSpot, how can we get them on SSL?
Is this something that HubSpot is going to let them on their shared SSL or is that only for teh full website people?
If you are managing their server i.e. Amazon you can set up let’s encrypt. if it is on Shared hosting you need to set up the ssl through the host.
I think .00001 percent of our accounts use amazon
lol.. well that is just an example

Hi Nick, HubSpot offers an SSL package for customers that do not have the Website Add-On.  Your account manager should be able to give you the details for adding it to client contracts, if they need it right now.  Additionally, the Product Team announced at Inbound and Developer Day that HubSpot is bringing free standard SSL to all customers by Q1.
:slightly_smiling_face:
thanks for that update
I know you guiys do a lot of .net stuff lets say azure
<@U22PKFRU5> by standard SSL, is that a single domain, or all HubSpot-hosted domains?

HubSpot is working as fast as we can to get standard SSL available in-app to all customers for free. This will be rolled out from now until Jan 1st. If you or your clients can’t wait until the migration of their portal, please fill out this form: <http://HubSpot.com/products/marketing/ssl> to have one of our customer support representatives work with you to schedule time to ungate them for standard SSL and perform the necessary DNS updates.

<@U26BLKGE4> -- It depends on their subscription. If it's Basic it's 1 domain, Professional 4 domains, and Enterprise is currently 8 domains they can encrypt. All "hs-sites" domains are already SSL-enabled.
They are using Lets Encrypt now so it is free for them to add it to all domains attached to HubSpot.
They just need a way to forward the root domain if it has ssl attached

non HS question here -- have a site(wordpress) on SSL, it has a million http: in it.  Trying to get rid of all the mixed content errors before I force SSL.  Should I just do a search/replace of http:// to https:// to fix these?  

I think that is the wrong way to do it, and instead do a search for src="http:// and change to src="//

Or is there a better way?
